result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Court reporter Tara Monthie. Defendant Pierre J Williams in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis P Raff in court for Pierre J Williams.  Attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: 3:34 PM Defendant Pierre J Williams in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis P Raff in court for Pierre J Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. Dane County Deputy Sheriff H. M., duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA Valerio. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty Raff. Witness excused. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over. Argument by Atty Raff. CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 17.

01:38 PM Defendant in court, in custody via Zoom with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
